verses.text: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and the LORD said to him, "You are old and advanced in years, and there remains yet very much land to possess.
verses.comment: Opening sets the context for the division of the remaining land.

verses.text: "This is the land that yet remains: all the regions of the Philistines, and all the Geshurites,
verses.comment: Philistine and Geshurite territories not yet conquered.

verses.text: "from the Shihor, which is east of Egypt, up to the border of Ekron to the north (it is counted as Canaanite), five rulers of the Philistines: the Gazaite, the Ashdodite, the Ashkelonite, the Gittite, and the Ekronite; also the Avvim
verses.comment: The Shihor likely refers to a river near Egypt, possibly the easternmost branch of the Nile.

verses.text: in the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, as far as Aphek, to the border of the Amorites;
verses.comment: Mearah means 'cave'; possibly a specific location along Phoenician coast.

verses.text: and the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrise, from Baal-gad below Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath,
verses.comment: Clarifies ancient places with their likely modern equivalents.

verses.text: all the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, all the Sidonians. I myself will drive them out before the children of Israel. Only allot the land to Israel for an inheritance, as I have commanded you.
verses.comment: God promises he himself will drive out the remaining inhabitants.

verses.text: Now therefore, divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.comment: Mention of the tribes remaining to receive territory; half of Manasseh already allotted east of the Jordan.

verses.text: With the other half-tribe, the Reubenites and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond the Jordan eastward, as Moses the servant of the LORD gave them:
verses.comment: Reuben, Gad, and half-Manasseh already allotted territory east of the Jordan.

verses.text: "from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the tableland of Medeba as far as Dibon;
verses.comment: Aroer and Medeba are important towns east of the Jordan.

verses.text: and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, as far as the border of the children of Ammon;
verses.comment: Recounts the territory Moses captured from Sihon.

verses.text: and Gilead, and the territory of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and all Mount Hermon, and all Bashan to Salecah;
verses.comment: Bashan and Gilead are northern regions east of the Jordan.

verses.text: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei (he alone was left of the remnant of the Rephaim); for Moses defeated and drove them out.
verses.comment: Og was one of the last of the Rephaim—giant-like people east of the Jordan.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the children of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maacathites; but Geshur and Maacath live among Israel to this day.
verses.comment: The continued presence of these peoples among Israel.

verses.text: Only to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance. The offerings made by fire to the LORD, the God of Israel, are their inheritance, as he said to them.
verses.comment: Levi’s portion is the LORD himself through the offerings.

verses.text: And Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their families.
verses.comment: The following verses detail the specific land granted to Reuben.

verses.text: And their territory was from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of the Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the tableland by Medeba;
verses.comment: Retells the cities comprising the territory.

verses.text: Heshbon, and all its cities that are in the tableland: Dibon, Bamoth-baal, and Beth-baal-meon,
verses.comment: City names listed plainly as in the Masoretic text.

verses.text: and Jahaz, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,
verses.comment: Continues the list of city allotments.

verses.text: and Kiriathaim, and Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar on the hill of the valley,
verses.comment: All city names left untranslated to retain accuracy.

verses.text: and Beth-peor, and the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth,
verses.comment: Adds well-known cities and landmarks.

verses.text: all the cities of the tableland, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses struck down with the leaders of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the princes of Sihon, who lived in the land.
verses.comment: Names of Midianite chiefs killed with Sihon noted.

verses.text: Also Balaam the son of Beor, the one who practiced divination, the Israelites killed with the sword among the rest of their slain.
verses.comment: Highlights Balaam’s role as a diviner.

verses.text: And the border of the children of Reuben was the Jordan as a boundary. This was the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Reuben according to their families—the cities and their villages.
verses.comment: Clarifies that these were Reuben’s lands.

verses.text: And Moses gave an inheritance also to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad according to their families.
verses.comment: Now the allotment to Gad is described.

verses.text: And their territory was Jazer and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites, as far as Aroer, which is east of Rabbah,
verses.comment: Lists locations in the territory east of the river Jordan.

verses.text: and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir,
verses.comment: Mentions obscure place-names without attempt to modernize them.

verses.text: and in the valley: Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan and its border, as far as the lower end of the Sea of Chinnereth east of the Jordan.
verses.comment: Sea of Chinnereth is the Sea of Galilee.

verses.text: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities and their villages.
verses.comment: Confirms these lands were given to Gad.

verses.text: And Moses gave an inheritance to half the tribe of Manasseh. It was for the half-tribe of the children of Manasseh according to their families.
verses.comment: Allotment to the half-tribe of Manasseh east of the Jordan.

verses.text: And their territory was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities;
verses.comment: Records that Jair captured 60 towns in Bashan.

verses.text: and half of Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, the cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan; these were allotted to the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, to half the children of Machir according to their families.
verses.comment: Machir was the forefather of this half-tribe.

verses.text: These are the inheritances that Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan, east of Jericho.
verses.comment: Summarizes the inheritances east of the Jordan.

verses.text: But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance; the LORD, the God of Israel, is their inheritance, as he promised them.
verses.comment: Repeats Levi’s unique inheritance: the LORD himself.
